% Table 1: Perplexity vs BER
\begin{table}[h]
\centering
\caption{Perplexity vs BER across protection strategies}
\begin{tabular}{lccccc}
\toprule
BER & FP16 & Hamming(7,4) & Hamming(8,4) & H(8,4)+Interp & Golay(24,12) \\
\midrule
0 & $1.42$ & $1.44$ & $1.44$ & $1.44$ & $1.44$ \\
$1e-04$ & $1.42$ & $1.44$ & $1.44$ & $1.44$ & $1.44$ \\
$1e-03$ & $1.42$ & $1.44$ & $1.44$ & $1.44$ & $1.44$ \\
$1e-02$ & $1.42$ & $1.51 \pm 0.05$ & $1.50 \pm 0.02$ & $1.44 \pm 0.02$ & $1.44$ \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}

% Table 4: Storage Overhead
\begin{table}[h]

\caption{Storage Overhead Comparison}
\label{tab:storage-overhead}
\begin{tabular}{lccc}
\toprule
Cache Mode & Bits/Value & Overhead vs INT4 & Overhead vs FP16 \\
\midrule
FP16 (Oracle) & 16 & +300\% & --- \\
FP8 (E4M3) & 8 & +100\% & $-50\%$ \\
INT4 (Unprotected) & 4 & --- & $-75\%$ \\
Hamming(7,4) & 7 & +75\% & $-56\%$ \\
Hamming(8,4) & 8 & +100\% & $-50\%$ \\
H(8,4)+Interp & 8 & +100\% & $-50\%$ \\
Golay(24,12) & 8 & +100\% & $-50\%$ \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}
